content:
Just ran across the spelling "behaviour" in some documentation. A quick rg shows that "behavior" is approximately 12x as common within the library directory, at least. Is there a preference towards one or the other? Having both seems a bit odd imo. If one is preferred, should I submit a PR changing the spellings?

(sorry if this is the wrong place to ask â€” nowhere was obviously correct)
Not worth a PR, I take it?
Not a big deal to me. Just surprised me to see that spelling.

the other one is built-in[a spelling] v. builtin [the type] where there are probably a
dozen or so changes that could be made
That might be my fault -- I don't always remember to take the us out when I'm writing docs...

Just ran across the spelling "behaviour" in some documentation.

Oh oops, six of those are mine.

Not worth a PR, I take it?

Feel free to send a PR if it bothers you. You can assign me with r? @m-ou-se.
Doesn't bother me in the slightest. Just wasn't sure which was preferred if writing documentation myself.
